{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326681,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T12:56:20.484Z","cooked":"

Given a lot of teams are using limelights ( ChArUco Camera Calibration | Limelight Documentation ) or just OpenCv’s Aruco with Charuco board calibrations.

I’m curious what your reprojection errors post calibration are?

Ours seem to come out to .5 typically. I’m not sure if I should be happy with that number, or be pushing for an even lower value.

Curious what others are getting

you can find the raspberry pi cam intrinsics measured by team 100 using a charuco board here

github.com

Team100/all24/blob/main/comp/vision/calibration.md

# Calibration

Joel did a round of calibration of the raspberry pi cameras v2 and v3 wide, using the scripts called calibration_recorder.py (to save some images), calibrate.py (to calculate the coefficients), and undistort.py (to view the results), yielding these results:

## V2 Camera

```
{'camera_matrix': {'cx': 421.5895522145918,
               	'cy': 318.3343004658085,
               	'fx': 657.9975417150848,
               	'fy': 660.1629265845845},

reprojection error for both the v2 and v3 wide cameras was around 0.2.

Wow, thats much better than us. Anything you specifically did in calibration?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T15:34:03.709Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457704,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-reprojection-error","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-reprojection-error/457704/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326848,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T16:32:58.896Z","cooked":"

i don’t think we did anything special. you can see the python scripts we used in that same directory: take a bunch of frames, then analyze them. we did pay particular attention to getting coverage of the entire frame, particularly the corners, at a range of distances from pretty-close (board covers most of the frame) to pretty-far (near the tag detection limit), so that meant being kinda slow and systematic about it. we had hundreds of frames to analyze.

the v2 camera looks pretty good with no correction at all, so i was a bit surprised to see the result here, which looks to me like a significant correction. the corrections do seem to help a lot with pose estimation for oblique views.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T16:32:58.896Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457704,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-reprojection-error","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-reprojection-error/457704/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326875,"name":"joemost","username":"joemost","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joemost/{size}/11114_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T16:48:51.186Z","cooked":"
truher:

pretty-far (near the tag detection limit)

was thinking about that… we took all our calibration points pretty close. we should probably take some further frames as well

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T16:48:51.186Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457704,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-reprojection-error","display_username":"joemost","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-reprojection-error/457704/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338564,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T17:17:07.214Z","cooked":"

after using the calibrated cameras for awhile, we’ve had some pretty poor localization results using targets near the edges of the camera frame, and i think these poor results are due to a solver failure in the calibration procedure itself. as the calib3d docs say, failed calibrations can look pretty good near the middle but produce wild results near the edges. i’ll post an updated calibration as soon as we have it.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T17:17:07.214Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457704,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-reprojection-error","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-reprojection-error/457704/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348434,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T16:41:50.982Z","cooked":"

an update in case anyone is still thinking about raspberry pi camera calibration: we built a big protractor rig to measure the radial distortion directly and updated the distortion coefficients I mentioned above. the new model is simpler, just k1 and k2, fit using a spreadsheet.

the most significant thing we learned was that the previous results were wrong – the calib3d docs actually warn about calibration failure of this type. we also learned that the pi cameras have significant tangential distortion, which we didn’t attempt to correct because we didn’t have time to test every camera in our quad-cam rig.

still, our undistorted results were good for 10cm accuracy from 5m, which is good enough.
